central_thesis: The central thesis of "The Demonic Bible" is that humanity's ultimate destiny is self-deification, achieved through a structured system of "deitic magic." This system involves a radical psychological and spiritual transformation, where the practitioner actively embodies the "Forces of Darkness" (archetypes of dynamic, evolving consciousness rather than static deities) to "become a god" in the proclaimed "Aeon of Lucifer." It asserts that the universe itself is a process of "becoming," and through conscious will (THELEMA) and self-evolution (XEPER), individuals can attain DEITUS (the power of a God), transcending conventional morality and creating their own reality.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Demonic Bible (Title Page)
structure_content.summary: Identifies the title and author, Magus Tsirk Susej, as an 'Antichrist, servant & disciple of the Dark Lord,' whose knowledge was 'revealed to him by his Unholy Guardian Demon the spirit Azael.'

structure_content.chapter_title: A New And Numinous Art
structure_content.summary: Argues that traditional art has sufficiently explored personal struggles and relationships. A new, numinous art is needed to explore the next stage of human evolution, focusing on supra-personal goals, moving beyond individuation to a conscious understanding of the self as both Destroyer and Creator, Lucifer and God. This new art should capture and express the numinous itself, leading to the creation of a new species: homo deitus.

structure_content.chapter_title: Preface to the Second Edition
structure_content.summary: Provides historical context, noting the influence of the Demonic Bible since its 1999/2004 release, its reproduction on Satanism websites, and its foundation of "deitic magic." It highlights influences from Thelemic (O.T.O./A.A.) and Setian (Church of Satan/Temple of Set) magic, and the septenary system of the O.N.A., emphasizing THELEMA and XEPER as paths to DEITUS. It reiterates that the work is not fiction and improper use can lead to psychological breakdown.

structure_content.chapter_title: Preface to the First Edition
structure_content.summary: Presents a radical critique of monotheistic religions, asserting that the omnipotent creator is inherently evil. It redefines traditional "gods" as "fallen" deities or "devils" worshipped by men, and frames the Demonic Bible as a source of "true and undefiled wisdom" for the brave, challenging conventional morality.

structure_content.chapter_title: Introduction to the 2nd Edition - Lucifer, the Light-Bearer
structure_content.summary: Traces the etymology of "Lucifer" from "light-bearer" (morning star Venus, personifying enlightenment) to its demonization by early Christianity. Explains "Satan" as a Hebrew term for "adversary," evolving in Zoroastrian-influenced Jewish mythology to a powerful adversary of God.

structure_content.chapter_title: Introduction to the 2nd Edition - Devil Worshippers and Luciferans
structure_content.summary: Discusses historical groups like the Gnostic Luciferans (who believed Lucifer was the true God) and Knights Templar, linking them to paganism and early forms of devil-worship that emerged under Christian oppression.

structure_content.chapter_title: Introduction to the 2nd Edition - Those Evil Masons & Brothers of the Rosy Cross
structure_content.summary: Explores the origins and myths of Masonic lodges, Rosicrucians, and the Golden Dawn, highlighting their engagement with hidden knowledge, Jewish Cabala, Egyptian Magic, and Enochian Keys. The Cabala is described as a mystical system for magical application using "words" and "names."

structure_content.chapter_title: Introduction to the 2nd Edition - A Beast of Revelation
structure_content.summary: Details Aleister Crowley's proclamation of the Aeon of Horus and THELEMA, his identification as the "Beast," and the syncretic nature of his magick, including Tantric sex magic and elements of Black Magic.

structure_content.chapter_title: Introduction to the 2nd Edition - The Age of Satan Begins
structure_content.summary: Chronicles Anton LaVey's founding of the Church of Satan in 1966, his philosophy of "indulgence instead of abstinence," and the Church's professed atheism, viewing Satan as a metaphor for defiance and a Jungian archetype.

structure_content.chapter_title: Introduction to the 2nd Edition - The Second Beast
structure_content.summary: Discusses Michael Aquino's 1975 departure from the Church of Satan to establish the Temple of Set, his proclamation of the Aeon of Set and the Word XEPER ("to become"). Set is presented as an ancient Egyptian god of the "night sky" and "expansion of consciousness," distinct from the Christian devil.

structure_content.chapter_title: Introduction to the 2nd Edition - The Nine Angles
structure_content.summary: Introduces the Order of Nine Angles (ONA) and its concept of Satan as an acausal entity. ONA initiates seek to "presence" Dark Forces and become "nexus's" or "gateways" to the acausal, furthering a "sinister dialectic of history."

structure_content.chapter_title: Introduction to the 2nd Edition - The Devil's Ambassadors
structure_content.summary: Mentions Yaj Nomolos and the First Embassy to the Dark Lord (S.A.T.A.N.), emphasizing a "Social Realist" philosophy of predator and prey, and Satan as an androgynous being.

structure_content.chapter_title: Introduction to the 2nd Edition - A New Embassy… A New Aeon
structure_content.summary: Describes Magus Tsirk Susej's establishment of the Embassy of Lucifer in 1991, leading to the discovery of DEITUS as the Word for the Aeon of Lucifer in 2000/2001. Susej integrated philosophies from various groups (TOS, COS, ONA) with rituals revealed by his "Unholy Guardian Demon," Azael. The Embassy aims to fulfill ONA objectives and create "homo deitus."

structure_content.chapter_title: Magus Tsirk Susej, Antichrist
structure_content.summary: Presents an autobiographical account of Chad Ian Miller (Magus Tsirk Susej), detailing his early interest in the occult, embrace of Satanism, contact with the spirit Azael, and the revelations that led to the Demonic Bible. His criminal past and a profound "abyss" experience are described as catalysts for his realization of DEITUS and becoming a Magus. He later explored Baha’i Faith, noting commonalities between Left- and Right-Hand Paths in seeking revelation.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Embassy of Lucifer
structure_content.summary: Details the history and evolution of the Embassy of Lucifer (EOL) and its ecclesiastical arm, the Royal Church of Lucifer (RCOL). Its goals include promoting DEITUS, uniting the Satanic Community, establishing an independent Satanic state, and acting as a diplomatic embassy. The EOL is presented as an evolving magical and philosophical temple, drawing from predecessors like OTO and COS, but distinct in its focus on DEITUS.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Magical Art
structure_content.summary: Explains magic as a means to control one's mind and conscious awareness, transforming the brain into a "transmitter" of telepathic signals. It posits that spirits and demons, even if subjectively existing, allow magicians to influence reality and acquire knowledge. The text warns against approaching magic intellectually, stressing the importance of the subconscious (right-brain) for effective practice, and warns of psychological dangers for the unprepared.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Dynamic Universe
structure_content.summary: Explores the nature of God, man, and the universe as dynamic and constantly "becoming." It critiques static, man-made gods and argues that Satan, as a symbol of dynamic change, more accurately reflects the true nature of God. The text links this to alchemical principles and modern physics, culminating in the idea that when Lucifer (man as God) rises, the Aeon of Lucifer begins.

structure_content.chapter_title: Concerning Christianity
structure_content.summary: Provides a historical and critical perspective on Christianity, from its Gnostic philosophical beginnings to its authoritarian and later emotional forms. It suggests that Christian scriptures, when read from a "satanic" perspective, reveal prophets and Jesus as practitioners of the Black Arts, implying that the true follower of the Dark Path is the "truest Apostle of Christ."

structure_content.chapter_title: Concerning Human Sacrifice
structure_content.summary: Discusses the rationale behind human sacrifice in magic as a means to raise magical energy, but acknowledges the legal dangers. It asserts the superiority of Satanists, stating that "the masses exist to serve" and "the life of one Satanist is worth the lives of a hundred thousand men," while emphasizing that this view does not imply moral or ethical obligations to murder.

structure_content.chapter_title: Concerning the Rituals
structure_content.summary: Describes the Demonic Bible as a collection of rituals revealed by Azael and other spirits, drawing from ancient grimoires and traditions (Abramelin, Solomonis, Necronomicon). It outlines a progressive system to "open the Gates of Hell" and "become one with the Forces of Darkness," emphasizing its psychological impact and potential dangers, including "demonic possession" or "mental illness," and the need for careful progression.

structure_content.chapter_title: Concerning Changes to the Rituals
structure_content.summary: Explains the adaptability of the Demonic Bible's rituals, allowing integration with other magical systems (e.g., Necronomicon, ONA Septenary). It clarifies that the rituals form a single, lifetime-long working to "initiate" oneself, become a "nexus" to acausal forces, and that sexual contact in rituals is for energy raising, not just the act itself.

structure_content.chapter_title: Ritual Tools & Supplies
structure_content.summary: Lists specific tools and supplies for group rituals, including silver-plated candle holders, brass incense burner, chalices, iron sword, dagger, bell, gong, "Unholy" Bread and Water, anointing oil, a trapezoidal altar with a black altar cloth, symbols of Baphomet/Setian Pentagram, an upside-down cross, black hooded robes, and amulets. It specifies that tools should be purchased new and consecrated.

structure_content.chapter_title: Group Ritual
structure_content.summary: Provides a step-by-step guide for a group ritual, outlining preparations, entrance, High Priestess's role on the altar, High Priest's actions (lighting incense, ringing bell, circumambulation, invocation), congregation's entry, meditation, preliminary statements, invocations, drinking from chalice, offerings, initiation of new members, and the sexual ritual performed by the High Priest and High Priestess.

structure_content.chapter_title: Concerning the Gods
structure_content.summary: Explains that demonic names are used as symbolic archetypes for powers, not unique beings. It asserts the "true" devil is the female Serpent of Chaos, Tiamat, and that many male demonic names are titles for her. It reinterprets witch covens as worshipping the Dark Goddess, emphasizing the female aspect of ultimate power, and states that great magicians are men chosen as lovers by the Dark Goddess.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Rituals (Practical Section Start)
structure_content.summary: Introduces the practical section, outlining the sequence of rituals for self-deification.

structure_content.chapter_title: Bath of Purification
structure_content.summary: Describes the initial ritual of bathing in salt water to eliminate psychic influences and be reborn "in the Image of Satan," dedicating oneself to the Dark Lord. Includes a sample invocation and steps for cleansing.

structure_content.chapter_title: Renunciation & Proclamation
structure_content.summary: A ritual to renounce God, Jesus, angels, archangels, the Holy Catholic Church, all that is holy/good, and all gods, while proclaiming Satan Lucifer as Lord, God of the Earth, and Master. Includes notes on the political and ethical context of this renunciation.

structure_content.chapter_title: Lord's Prayer Backwards
structure_content.summary: A ritual involving reciting the "Lord's Prayer" backwards nine times, implied to be an act of reversal and blasphemy to align with dark forces.

structure_content.chapter_title: Pact Giving Body, Mind, & Soul
structure_content.summary: A ritual where the practitioner writes and burns a pact, dedicating their body, mind, and soul to Lucifer, followed by drinking from a chalice as a sacrifice.

structure_content.chapter_title: Ritual of Consecration
structure_content.summary: A detailed ritual to bless and consecrate each part of the body (feet, legs, genitals, abdomen, chest, buttocks, back, hands, arms, shoulders, neck, eyes, nose, mouth, ears, cheeks, chin, forehead, face, head) in the names of Satan and Lucifer, transforming the body into a temple for the Dark Lord.

structure_content.chapter_title: Invocation of the Unholy Trinity
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure the Unholy Trinity of Hell to manifest within the practitioner's body, transforming it into a prepared temple. Followed by drinking from a chalice.

structure_content.chapter_title: Invocation of the Unholy Spirit
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure the Unholy Spirit to manifest within the practitioner's body, transforming it into a prepared temple and filling them with the Unholy Spirit. Followed by drinking from a chalice.

structure_content.chapter_title: Invocation of the Nine Lords of the Abyss
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure the Nine Great Lords of the Abyss to manifest within the practitioner's body and send forth the Unholy Guardian Demon. Followed by drinking from a chalice.

structure_content.chapter_title: Invocation of Your Unholy Guardian Demon
structure_content.summary: A specific ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure the practitioner's Unholy Guardian Demon (Azael) to manifest within the body and guide them on the "dark path." Followed by drinking from a chalice.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Four Kings
structure_content.summary: Provides context for invoking the Four Demon Kings (Mahazael, Samael, Zimimay, Corson) who rule the quarters of the Earth, signaling the crossing of the Gates of Hell.

structure_content.chapter_title: Invocation of Mahazael (King and Ruler of the Southern Quarter)
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure Mahazael, King of the Southern Quarter, to manifest within the practitioner's body, set apart for the Dark Lord.

structure_content.chapter_title: Invocation of Samael (King and Ruler of the Eastern Quarter)
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure Samael, King of the Eastern Quarter, to manifest within the practitioner's body, set apart for the Dark Lord.

structure_content.chapter_title: Invocation of Zimimay (King and Ruler of the Northern Quarter)
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure Zimimay, King of the Northern Quarter, to manifest within the practitioner's body, set apart for the Dark Lord.

structure_content.chapter_title: Invocation of Corson (King and Ruler of the Western Quarter)
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure Corson, King of the Western Quarter, to manifest within the practitioner's body, set apart for the Dark Lord.

structure_content.chapter_title: Crossing the Gates of Hell - Invocation of Satan
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure Satan to manifest within the practitioner's body, open the Gates of Hell, allow the practitioner to cross and become like Satan, and consecrate/sanctify/bless the practitioner in Satan's name.

structure_content.chapter_title: Crossing the Gates of Hell - Invocation of Lucifer
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure Lucifer to manifest within the practitioner's body, open the Gates of Hell, allow the practitioner to cross and become like Lucifer, and consecrate/sanctify/bless the practitioner in Lucifer's name.

structure_content.chapter_title: Crossing the Gates of Hell - Invocation of Belial
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure Belial to manifest within the practitioner's body, open the Gates of Hell, allow the practitioner to cross and become like Belial, and consecrate/sanctify/bless the practitioner in Belial's name.

structure_content.chapter_title: Crossing the Gates of Hell - Invocation of Leviatan
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure Leviatan to manifest within the practitioner's body, open the Gates of Hell, allow the practitioner to cross and become like Leviatan, and consecrate/sanctify/bless the practitioner in Leviatan's name.

structure_content.chapter_title: Ritual to Become the Devil Incarnate
structure_content.summary: A cumulative declaration recited three times, affirming the practitioner's identity as Satan, Lucifer, Belial, Leviatan, the Devil Incarnate, and embodying these entities across the cardinal directions and elemental spheres (fire, air, earth, water).

structure_content.chapter_title: The Eight Sub-Princes of Hell
structure_content.summary: Introduces the Eight Sub-Princes (Astarot, Magot, Asmodee, Belzebud, Oriens, Paimon, Ariton, Amaimon) as the next stage after the Four Crown Princes, serving to open the "Locks of the Abyss." The author notes a correction in the spelling of "Leviatan" based on a dream experience and later realization from Grimoire of AbraMelin.

structure_content.chapter_title: Initial Statement (Eight Sub-Princes)
structure_content.summary: A preliminary statement for the invocation of the Eight Sub-Princes, affirming previous achievements (crossing Gates, becoming Devil Incarnate, embodying the Four Kings) and announcing the opening of the Locks of the Abyss.

structure_content.chapter_title: Invocation of Astarot/The 1st Sub-Prince
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure Astarot to manifest within the practitioner's body, open the Gates of Hell, and consecrate/sanctify/bless in Astarot's name.

structure_content.chapter_title: Invocation of Magot/The 2nd Sub-Prince
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure Magot to manifest within the practitioner's body, open the Gates of Hell, and consecrate/sanctify/bless in Magot's name.

structure_content.chapter_title: Invocation of Asmodee/The 3rd Sub-Prince
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure Asmodee to manifest within the practitioner's body, open the Gates of Hell, and consecrate/sanctify/bless in Asmodee's name.

structure_content.chapter_title: Invocation of Belzebud/The 4th Sub-Prince
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure Belzebud to manifest within the practitioner's body, open the Gates of Hell, and consecrate/sanctify/bless in Belzebud's name.

structure_content.chapter_title: Invocation of Oriens/The 5th Sub-Prince
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure Oriens to manifest within the practitioner's body, open the Gates of Hell, and consecrate/sanctify/bless in Oriens' name.

structure_content.chapter_title: Invocation of Paimon/The 6th Sub-Prince
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure Paimon to manifest within the practitioner's body, open the Gates of Hell, and consecrate/sanctify/bless in Paimon's name.

structure_content.chapter_title: Invocation of Ariton/The 7th Sub-Prince
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure Ariton to manifest within the practitioner's body, open the Gates of Hell, and consecrate/sanctify/bless in Ariton's name.

structure_content.chapter_title: Invocation of Amaimon/The 8th Sub-Prince
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure Amaimon to manifest within the practitioner's body, open the Gates of Hell, and consecrate/sanctify/bless in Amaimon's name.

structure_content.chapter_title: Opening the Nine Locks of the Abyss
structure_content.summary: Introduces the ritual to open the Nine Locks of the Abyss, involving calling upon the Nine Lords of the Abyss to gain power. The text links the 4 Crown Princes and 8 Sub-Princes to 12 "Gates of Hell" (elemental and angular) and the 9 "Locks of the Abyss" to angles above the earth, totaling 72 "Lords of the Djinn."

structure_content.chapter_title: Initial Statement (Nine Locks)
structure_content.summary: A preliminary statement for opening the Nine Locks, affirming the practitioner's status as Devil Incarnate and holding the keys to the Abyss, announcing the opening of the *first* lock.

structure_content.chapter_title: Invocation of Paimon/The 1st Lock
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure Paimon to manifest within the practitioner's body and open the first lock of the abyss, followed by a declaration that "The first lock is open."

structure_content.chapter_title: Invocation of Amaymon/The 2nd Lock
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure Amaymon to manifest within the practitioner's body and open the second lock of the abyss, followed by a declaration that "The second lock is open."

structure_content.chapter_title: Invocation of Asmodeus/The 3rd Lock
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure Asmodeus to manifest within the practitioner's body and open the third lock of the abyss, followed by a declaration that "The third lock is open."

structure_content.chapter_title: Invocation of Beelzebub/The 4th Lock
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure Beelzebub to manifest within the practitioner's body and open the fourth lock of the abyss, followed by a declaration that "The fourth lock is open."

structure_content.chapter_title: Invocation of Astaroth/The 5th Lock
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure Astaroth to manifest within the practitioner's body and open the fifth lock of the abyss, followed by a declaration that "The fifth lock is open."

structure_content.chapter_title: Invocation of Oriens/The 6th Lock
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure Oriens to manifest within the practitioner's body and open the sixth lock of the abyss, followed by a declaration that "The sixth lock is open."

structure_content.chapter_title: Invocation of Magot/The 7th Lock
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure Magot to manifest within the practitioner's body and open the seventh lock of the abyss, followed by a declaration that "The seventh lock is open."

structure_content.chapter_title: Invocation of Dagon/The 8th Lock
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure Dagon to manifest within the practitioner's body and open the eighth lock of the abyss, followed by a declaration that "The eighth lock is open."

structure_content.chapter_title: Invocation of Moloch/The 9th Lock
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure Moloch to manifest within the practitioner's body and open the ninth lock of the abyss, followed by a declaration that "The ninth lock is open."

structure_content.chapter_title: Opening the Abyss
structure_content.summary: A ritual declaring that the Nine Locks of the Abyss have been opened, and "The Abyss is open beneath me. The Abyss is open around me. The Abyss is open within me." Recited three times, followed by drinking from a chalice.

structure_content.chapter_title: Invocation of the Beast
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure the Beast of Revelation to manifest within the practitioner's body, place its mark, and empower the practitioner as the Devil Incarnate, embodying Satan, Lucifer, Belial, and Leviatan.

structure_content.chapter_title: Invocation of the Whore of Babylon
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure the Whore of Babylon to manifest within the practitioner's body, ride upon the practitioner "as you do upon the Beast," and empower the practitioner as the Devil Incarnate.

structure_content.chapter_title: Invocation of the dragon Choronzon
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure the dragon Choronzon to manifest within the practitioner's body, and empower the practitioner as the Devil Incarnate.

structure_content.chapter_title: Invocation of the Antichrist
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure the Antichrist to manifest within the practitioner's body, and empower the practitioner as the Devil Incarnate.

structure_content.chapter_title: Invocation of Dracula (or "Ritual to Become a Vampire")
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure Dracula to manifest within the practitioner's body, drink of the practitioner's blood, allowing the practitioner to become one of the undead, one with the Forces of Darkness, and the Devil Incarnate.

structure_content.chapter_title: Invocation of Lycanthrope (or "Ritual to Become a Werewolf")
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure Lycanthrope to manifest within the practitioner's body, eat of the practitioner's flesh, allowing the practitioner to become one of the undead, one with the Forces of Darkness, and the Devil Incarnate.

structure_content.chapter_title: Invocation of Mormo (or "Ritual to Become a Ghoul")
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure Mormo to manifest within the practitioner's body, drink of the practitioner's blood and eat of their flesh, allowing the practitioner to become one of the undead, one with the Forces of Darkness, and the Devil Incarnate.

structure_content.chapter_title: Invocation of Legion (or "Ritual to Become Demonically Possessed")
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure Legion to manifest within the practitioner's body, enter it, allowing the practitioner to become like Legion, one with the Forces of Darkness, and the Devil Incarnate.

structure_content.chapter_title: The 72 Djinn of Babylon
structure_content.summary: Provides historical context for the 72 Djinn (from Goetia/Lesser Key of Solomon) as powerful spirits ruling the earth. It explains that by crossing the Gates of Hell and uniting with the Forces of Darkness, the magician can befriend these beings. Includes descriptions and seals for the first 25 Djinn.

structure_content.chapter_title: Invocation for any of the Lords of the Djinn
structure_content.summary: Provides a general invocation template for calling any of the 72 Djinn, manifesting them within the body, and requesting power, knowledge, blessing, and favor.

structure_content.chapter_title: Rituals of Death & Resurrection - Baptism
structure_content.summary: A ritual of self-sacrifice and descent into the underworld, crossing the River Styx, and being baptized in its waters and the "Flames of Hell," marked by an inverted cross, symbolizing rebirth in the image of Satan.

structure_content.chapter_title: Rituals of Death & Resurrection - Invocation of the Lord of the Underworld
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure various Lords of the Underworld (Pluto, Hades, Anubis, Samhein, Kutha) to manifest within the practitioner's body, leading to the practitioner becoming the Lord of the Underworld and Devil Incarnate.

structure_content.chapter_title: Rituals of Death & Resurrection - Invocation of the Queen of the Underworld
structure_content.summary: A ritual for male practitioners to invoke, summon, and conjure Queens of the Underworld (Hela, Persephone, Proserpine, Ereshkigal) to manifest within their body and take them as wife/lover, affirming the practitioner's status as Lord of the Underworld and Devil Incarnate. Includes a note for female practitioners to adapt the ritual to become the Queen and take the Horned God.

structure_content.chapter_title: Rituals of Death & Resurrection - Ordination as a Priest of the Dark Lord
structure_content.summary: A ritual of returning to Earth reborn in the Image of Satan, consecrated as a living demon, and ordained as a priest and ambassador of the Dark Lord. Involves anointing the forehead with "unholy oil" in an inverted pentagram.

structure_content.chapter_title: Rituals of Death & Resurrection - Invocation of the Lord of the Earth
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure various Horned Gods of the Earth (Pan, Bacchus, Dionysus, Kernunnos, Herne) to manifest within the practitioner's body, leading to the practitioner becoming the Horned God of the Earth and Devil Incarnate.

structure_content.chapter_title: Rituals of Death & Resurrection - Invocation of the Queen of the Earth
structure_content.summary: A ritual for male practitioners to invoke, summon, and conjure Queens of the Earth/Goddesses of pleasure and fertility (Ishtar, Inanna, Isis, Demeter, Ceres) to manifest within their body and take them as wife/lover, affirming the practitioner's status as Horned God of the Earth and Devil Incarnate. Includes a note for female practitioners to adapt the ritual.

structure_content.chapter_title: Spirits of Abomination
structure_content.summary: Describes various "abominations of chaos" (HUMWAWA, PAZUZU, AKHKHARU, LALASSU, LALARTU, GELAL, LILIT, XASTUR), providing their descriptions and seals for invocation after union with the Dragon of Chaos.

structure_content.chapter_title: Invocation for any of the Abomination of Chaos
structure_content.summary: Provides a general invocation template for calling any of the Abominations of Chaos to manifest within the practitioner's body, asserting their status as Devil Incarnate, and granting power, knowledge, blessing, and favor.

structure_content.chapter_title: Crossing the Nine Spheres (or Nine Angles between the worlds)
structure_content.summary: Explains this ritual as a way for the magician to look into the Abyss, beyond the causal, to witness the acausal. It states that this ritual, performed by staring into a mirror, will "consume/destroy the deluded" and warns of its dangers. It aims to enter the "666th dimension" and become a god.

structure_content.chapter_title: Crossing the Planetary Spheres - Preliminary Statement
structure_content.summary: A preliminary statement for crossing the Planetary Spheres, affirming the practitioner's status as Devil Incarnate and announcing the crossing of the seven spheres above the earth.

structure_content.chapter_title: Crossing the Planetary Spheres - The Lunar Sphere
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure Hecate (associated with the Lunar Sphere) to manifest within the practitioner's body, open the gate, and allow ascent through the planetary spheres.

structure_content.chapter_title: Crossing the Planetary Spheres - The Mercurial Sphere
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure Thoth (associated with the Mercurial Sphere) to manifest within the practitioner's body, open the gate, and allow ascent through the planetary spheres.

structure_content.chapter_title: Crossing the Planetary Spheres - The Venerial Sphere
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure Ishtar (associated with the Venerial Sphere) to manifest within the practitioner's body, open the gate, and allow ascent through the planetary spheres.

structure_content.chapter_title: Crossing the Planetary Spheres - The Solar Sphere
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure Azael (associated with the Solar Sphere) to manifest within the practitioner's body, open the gate, and allow ascent through the planetary spheres.

structure_content.chapter_title: Crossing the Planetary Spheres - The Martial Sphere
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure Abaddon (associated with the Martial Sphere) to manifest within the practitioner's body, open the gate, and allow ascent through the planetary spheres.

structure_content.chapter_title: Crossing the Planetary Spheres - The Jovial Sphere
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure Marduk (associated with the Jovial Sphere) to manifest within the practitioner's body, open the gate, and allow ascent through the planetary spheres.

structure_content.chapter_title: Crossing the Planetary Spheres - The Sanguine Sphere
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure Cronus (associated with the Sanguine Sphere) to manifest within the practitioner's body, open the gate, and allow ascent through the planetary spheres.

structure_content.chapter_title: Planetary Demonic Spirits
structure_content.summary: Introduces the invocation of demonic spirits associated with each planetary sphere, citing the 50 Names of Marduk from the Necronomicon as an example for the Jovial Sphere. Provides descriptions and seals for the first 12 names of Marduk (MARDUK, MARUKKA, MARUTUKKU, BARASHAKUSHU, LUGGALDIMMERANKIA, NARILUGGALDIMMERANKIA, ASARULUDU, NAMTILLAKU, NAMRU, ASARU, ASARUALIM, ASARUALIMMUNNA, TUTU, ZIUKKINNA, ZIKU, AGAKU, TUKU, SHAZU, ZISI, SUHRIM, SUHGURIM, ZAHRIM, ZAHGURIM, ENBILULU, EPADUN, ENBILULUGUGAL, HEGAL, SIRSIR, MALAH, GIL, GILMA, AGILMA, ZULUM, MUMMU, ZULUMMAR, LUGALABDUBUR, PAGALGUENNA, LUGALDURMAH, ARANUNNA, DUMUDUKU, LUGALANNA, LUGALUGGA, IRKINGU, KINMA, ESIZKUR, GIBIL, ADDU, ASHARRU, NEBIRU, NINNUAM).

structure_content.chapter_title: Invocation for any of the Names of Marduk
structure_content.summary: Provides a general invocation template for calling any of the 50 Names of Marduk to manifest within the practitioner's body, assert their status as Devil Incarnate, and grant power, knowledge, blessing, and favor.

structure_content.chapter_title: Ritual of Descent - Preliminary Statement
structure_content.summary: A preliminary statement for the Ritual of Descent, affirming the practitioner's crossing of Planetary Spheres and interaction with Azonei and Igiggi, and announcing the descent to the Realm of Chaos.

structure_content.chapter_title: Ritual of Descent - The First Gate
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure Ereshkigal to manifest within the practitioner's body, open the gate, and allow descent to the Realm of Chaos.

structure_content.chapter_title: Ritual of Descent - The Second Gate
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure Azag-Thoth to manifest within the practitioner's body, open the gate, and allow descent to the Realm of Chaos.

structure_content.chapter_title: Ritual of Descent - The Third Gate
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure Lillith to manifest within the practitioner's body, open the gate, and allow descent to the Realm of Chaos.

structure_content.chapter_title: Ritual of Descent - The Fourth Gate
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure Nininghisa to manifest within the practitioner's body, open the gate, and allow descent to the Realm of Chaos.

structure_content.chapter_title: Ritual of Descent - The Fifth Gate
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure Kingu to manifest within the practitioner's body, open the gate, and allow descent to the Realm of Chaos.

structure_content.chapter_title: Ritual of Descent - The Sixth Gate
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure Ktullu to manifest within the practitioner's body, open the gate, and allow descent to the Realm of Chaos.

structure_content.chapter_title: Ritual of Descent - The Seventh Gate
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure Absu to manifest within the practitioner's body, open the gate, and allow descent to the Realm of Chaos.

structure_content.chapter_title: Ritual of Descent - Invocation of the Ancient One, Tiamat
structure_content.summary: A profound ritual of self-sacrifice and complete dedication to Tiamat, the Ancient One and Dragon of Chaos. The practitioner gives body, mind, soul, flesh, blood, spirit, life, and future generations to Tiamat, pledging service and love, aiming for union with the Dragon of Chaos. Notes indicate that Absu is the male dragon, Tiamat the female, and the union symbolizes oneness in the Realm of Chaos.

structure_content.chapter_title: Crossing the Nine Spheres (or Nine Angles between the worlds) - Preliminary Statement
structure_content.summary: A preliminary statement for crossing the nine spheres/angles, affirming entry into the "666th dimension" and becoming a god at the center of the universe. The ritual requires staring into a mirror, cautioning that it reveals oneself and can destroy the deluded.

structure_content.chapter_title: Crossing the Nine Spheres (or Nine Angles between the worlds) - The First Sphere
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure Set to manifest within the practitioner's body, transforming it into a temple, followed by a declaration of having crossed the first sphere/angle.

structure_content.chapter_title: Crossing the Nine Spheres (or Nine Angles between the worlds) - The Second Sphere
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure Tchort to manifest within the practitioner's body, transforming it into a temple, followed by a declaration of having crossed the second sphere/angle.

structure_content.chapter_title: Crossing the Nine Spheres (or Nine Angles between the worlds) - The Third Sphere
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure Shiva to manifest within the practitioner's body, transforming it into a temple, followed by a declaration of having crossed the third sphere/angle.

structure_content.chapter_title: Crossing the Nine Spheres (or Nine Angles between the worlds) - The Fourth Sphere
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure Kali to manifest within the practitioner's body, transforming it into a temple, followed by a declaration of having crossed the fourth sphere/angle.

structure_content.chapter_title: Crossing the Nine Spheres (or Nine Angles between the worlds) - The Fifth Sphere
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure Ahrimon to manifest within the practitioner's body, transforming it into a temple, followed by a declaration of having crossed the fifth sphere/angle.

structure_content.chapter_title: Crossing the Nine Spheres (or Nine Angles between the worlds) - The Sixth Sphere
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure Gorgo to manifest within the practitioner's body, transforming it into a temple, followed by a declaration of having crossed the sixth sphere/angle.

structure_content.chapter_title: Crossing the Nine Spheres (or Nine Angles between the worlds) - The Seventh Sphere
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure Demogorgon to manifest within the practitioner's body, transforming it into a temple, followed by a declaration of having crossed the seventh sphere/angle.

structure_content.chapter_title: Crossing the Nine Spheres (or Nine Angles between the worlds) - The Eighth Sphere
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure Shaitan to manifest within the practitioner's body, transforming it into a temple, followed by a declaration of having crossed the eighth sphere/angle.

structure_content.chapter_title: Crossing the Nine Spheres (or Nine Angles between the worlds) - The Ninth Sphere
structure_content.summary: A ritual to invoke, summon, and conjure MelekTaus to manifest within the practitioner's body, transforming it into a temple, followed by a declaration of having crossed the ninth sphere/angle.

structure_content.chapter_title: Entering the 666th Dimension
structure_content.summary: A culminating statement, declaring the practitioner's successful crossing of the nine spheres/angles, entry into the "666th dimension," and becoming a "dark god upon the earth."

structure_content.chapter_title: Waging War on the Heavens
structure_content.summary: An optional, historical ritual (not in the first edition) performed by the author after reaching the 666th dimension. It involves invoking demons to join an army, imagining battling angels and bringing Archangel Michael to his knees, crucifying Jesus, raping the Virgin Mary, and mocking the Cabala, culminating in the practitioner sitting on the "Throne of All Creation."

structure_content.chapter_title: Proclaiming a New Aeon
structure_content.summary: An optional, historical ritual (not in the first edition) performed by the author. It involves speaking the Word DEITUS to destroy the old universe and create a new one, proclaiming the Aeon of Lucifer, and declaring oneself a Magus and God through THELEMA and XEPER. Includes powerful affirmations of divine status and dominion over all creation.

structure_content.chapter_title: Initial Statement (Cumulative Achievement)
structure_content.summary: A comprehensive statement summarizing all the practitioner's achievements within the system: consecrating the body as a temple, setting oneself apart, crossing Gates of Hell, becoming Devil Incarnate, embodying various demonic figures, opening Locks of the Abyss, receiving the Mark of the Beast, descending to the underworld, baptism, rebirth as a living demon, ordination as a priest, union with Dark Goddess, crossing planetary spheres, descending to Realm of Chaos, becoming one with Tiamat, crossing Nine Spheres/Angles, entering the 666th dimension, becoming a dark god, waging war on heavens, sitting on Throne of All Creation, speaking the Word of the Aeon, becoming Magus, and attaining DEITUS.

structure_content.chapter_title: General Invocation for Calling Any of the Spirits
structure_content.summary: Provides a universal invocation template for calling any spirit, manifesting it within the practitioner's body, asserting the practitioner's status as the "Unholy of Unholies" and Devil Incarnate, and demanding power, knowledge, blessing, and favor.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Spirits Which May Be Called
structure_content.summary: A comprehensive list of various spirits from diverse mythologies and demonologies (e.g., Abraxas, Dracula, Lilith, Behemoth, Kraken, Typhon), providing a vast resource for the practitioner to invoke using the general invocation formula. The author notes that researching each spirit is not necessary as each name possesses inherent power.

structure_content.chapter_title: MAP OF THE SPHERES
structure_content.summary: A diagrammatic representation of the magical cosmology, categorizing different realms and entities: The Aeonic Sphere (Isis, Osiris, Horus, Set, Lucifer), The Ayres (30 divisions of earth/heavens), The Upper Heavens (nine orders of angels), The Lower Heavens (Fixed Stars, Azonei & Igiggi), The Astral Spheres (planetary spirits), Material World (WatchTowers, Dark Gods, Elemental Spheres/Spirits), The Nine Locks of the Abyss, The Underworld (Gods/Spirits of Dead), Realm of Chaos (Ancient Ones, Dragons of Chaos, Spirits of Chaos), and The Nine Angles.

key_concepts.definition: The achievement of the power of a God; the ultimate state where man realizes he is God and embodies divine authority. It is the Word of the Aeon of Lucifer, signifying 'Will to come into being as a God.'
An Egyptian word meaning 'to become' or 'to come into being,' representing the process of self-evolution and expansion of consciousness through which a magician attains their true Will and DEITUS.

The Greek word for 'Will,' specifically referring to the magical Will – the true will of the magician's higher self or Holy Guardian Angel. It is foundational for the process of XEPER and the attainment of DEITUS.

The current epoch proclaimed by Magus Tsirk Susej, succeeding the Aeons of Isis, Osiris, and Set. It is characterized by humanity achieving godhood, Lucifer's rise, the conquest of the heavens, and the return of the Ancient Ones.

Archetypal representations of dynamic, evolving consciousness and the 'Forces of Darkness,' rather than static deities. These entities are seen as aspects of the practitioner's own psyche to be embodied, including figures like Satan, Lucifer, Belial, Leviatan (male) and Tiamat, Astaroth, Ishtar, Hela (female).
The specific spirit that revealed the rituals of the Demonic Bible to Magus Tsirk Susej. It serves as a personal guide to the 'dark path' and an internal manifestation of the Forces of Darkness.

Symbolic entry points to the acausal, non-spatial reality where the 'Forces of Darkness' reside. Crossing them is a foundational step in the ritual system for self-transformation and embodiment of demonic archetypes.

A sequential series of ritual steps involving the invocation of nine 'Lords of the Abyss' (Paimon, Amaymon, Asmodeus, Beelzebub, Astaroth, Oriens, Magot, Dagon, Moloch) to access deeper levels of chaos and power, conceptually linked to the 72 Djinn of Babylon.

A series of ritual steps designed to allow the magician to 'look into the Abyss,' transcending causal reality to witness the acausal. This culminates in entering the '666th Dimension,' a state of profound self-deification where the practitioner becomes a 'dark god.'

A practical system for controlling the mind and conscious awareness, transforming the brain from a 'receiver' to a 'transmitter' of telepathic signals. It operates through the subconscious (right-brain function) and involves stimulating specific brain areas associated with the invoked 'Forces of Darkness.'

The envisioned new species of higher beings that humanity is evolving into during the Aeon of Lucifer. This refers to humans who have consciously embraced their divine potential and become gods upon the earth.

A concept borrowed from the Order of Nine Angles, referring to the process of influencing and transforming the world towards a 'sinister' (i.e., chaotic, evolutionary, and anti-conventional) direction. The Embassy of Lucifer sees itself as fulfilling this objective by 'presencing the Forces of Darkness.'

practical_system.description: The practical system outlined in "The Demonic Bible" is a progressive series of individual and optional group rituals, termed "deitic magic," designed for the ultimate goal of self-deification. It begins with physical and psychological preparation (purification, renunciation), progresses through pact-making and self-consecration, and then involves hierarchical invocations of various demonic entities. The system aims for the practitioner to embody the "Forces of Darkness," cross symbolic "Gates of Hell," traverse "Planetary Spheres" and "Nine Angles," and ultimately enter the "666th Dimension" to become a living god. The rituals are meant to be a lifetime undertaking, promoting an internal transformation where external entities are manifested within the practitioner's psyche, stimulating specific brain regions associated with power, knowledge, and enlightenment.

relevant_quotes.text: The Demonic Bible by Magus Tsirk Susej, Antichrist servant & disciple of the Dark Lord as revealed to him by his Unholy Guardian Demon the spirit Azael
This is not a “work of fiction” but rather the foundation of what is now known as deitic magic.
Satanists are superior. The masses exist to serve. The life of one Satanist is worth the lives of a hundred thousand men.

If spirits or demons exist objectively, as actual intelligent beings, then one might think that they would have more important things to do than appear before a “magic circle” and serve the whims of mere mortals. One might also think that there would then be one “correct” tradition of magic and one “true” pantheon of deities. This is not at all the case. All systems of magic use similar techniques and work relatively the same. The fact that magic based on the worship of pagan gods has the same efficiency as magic based on the Hebrew Cabala and Christian Gnosticism, shows that it is the techniques used (and their effect upon the practitioner's mind) which accounts for magical powers and not the particular deities or spirits called upon.

I AM not, but am becoming. The universe IS not, but is becoming. And if I, who possess consciousness, am becoming, then the consciousness which guides and/or controls the universe, from which my consciousness has its source, must also be becoming. The dialectic method of thesis/anti-thesis and synthesis is the process by which the universal dynamic evolves. I am not my flesh or my blood. I am not my brain or my body. In realizing that the "I AM" of my being is pure consciousness, I realize that I am God; I am the universe made manifest. And that which I call Lucifer, the embodiment of wisdom and enlightenment, is also changing, it is also becoming. It is within me, it flows through me, it is what the "I AM" of my being is. I am Lucifer. I am Satan.
The Word of the Aeon is DEITUS for a man has become god, Lucifer has risen, the heavens have been conquered; the Ancient Ones rule once more.

I have consecrated my body as a Temple to the Dark Lord, I have set myself apart to the Dark Lord and the Forces of Darkness. I have crossed the Gates of Hell and I have become the Devil Incarnate. I am Satan; I am Lucifer; I am Belial; and I am Leviatan. I have opened the Nine Locks of the Abyss and have received the Mark of the Beast. I have descended into the underworld, crossing the River Styx. I have been baptized in the River Styx and in the Flames of Hell. I have been reborn in the Image of Satan, as a living demon in the flesh. I have been ordained as a priest of the Dark Lord and ambassador of His Infernal Empire. I have sat upon the Throne of the Infernal Empire as Lord of the Living and the Dead. I have taken the Dark Goddess as my wife and as my lover. I have crossed the Planetary Spheres, the seven spheres above the earth, I have walked amonst the Azonei, the Unzoned Ones, and the wanderers from the wastes. I have performed the Ritual of Descent. I have descended to the Realm of Chaos. I have become one with the Ancient One, the Dragon of Chaos. I have crossed the Nine Spheres, the Nine Angles between the Worlds. I have stood at the center of the universe and become a god upon the earth… I have become a dark god upon the earth. I have risen up waging war on the heavens and, by stealth, have conquered the heavens. I have sat upon the Throne of All Creation as Lord of Heaven, of Earth, and of Hell. I have spoken the Word of the Aeon and become Magus of the Aeon. By THELEMA, and by XEPER, I have become DEITUS.

critical_analysis.relevance: "The Demonic Bible" by Magus Tsirk Susej is highly relevant within contemporary Western Esotericism, particularly for practitioners of the Left-Hand Path, Satanism, and Luciferianism. It offers a unique synthesis of diverse magical traditions, including Thelema, Setianism, and the Order of Nine Angles, providing a comprehensive framework for self-deification. Its emphasis on internal psychological transformation alongside external ritual, and its redefinition of divinity as a dynamic, evolving consciousness, presents a radical departure from traditional religious and even some established occult perspectives. The text provides a practical, progressive system for engaging with and embodying 'dark' archetypes, directly addressing the operative side of magic.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience for "The Demonic Bible" is experienced occult practitioners, particularly those engaged with Left-Hand Path, Satanic, or Luciferian philosophies. The text explicitly warns that improper use can lead to 'psychological breakdown' and 'demonic possession,' indicating it is not for novices. It is intended for individuals seeking intensive, transformative magical systems focused on self-deification, who possess a strong psychological foundation and a willingness to transcend conventional moral frameworks. The progressive nature of its rituals requires sustained commitment and an understanding of advanced magical concepts and their potential impact on the psyche.
